VMware NSX for vSphere 6.2.3 API Guide

Introduction

This manual, the NSX for vSphere API Guide, describes how to install, configure, monitor, and maintain the VMware® NSX system by using REST API requests.

Intended Audience

This manual is intended for anyone who wants to use REST API to programmatically control NSX in a VMware vSphere environment. The information in this manual is written for experienced developers who are familiar with virtual machine technology, virtualized datacenter operations, and REST APIs. This manual also assumes familiarity with NSX for vSphere.

VMware Technical Publications Glossary

VMware Technical Publications provides a glossary of terms that might be unfamiliar to you. For definitions of terms as they are used in VMware technical documentation go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Document Feedback

VMware welcomes your suggestions for improving our documentation. If you have comments, send your feedback to docfeedback@vmware.com.

NSX Documentation

The following documents comprise the NSX documentation set:

  • NSX for vSphere Administration Guide
  • NSX for vSphere Installation and Upgrade
  • NSX API Programming Guide

Technical Support and Education Resources

The following sections describe the technical support resources available to you. To access the current version of this book and other books, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Online and Telephone Support

To use online support to submit technical support requests, view your product and contract information, and register your products, go to http://www.vmware.com/support.

Customers with appropriate support contracts should use telephone support for the fastest response on priority 1 issues. Go to http://www.vmware.com/support/phone_support.

Support Offerings

To find out how VMware support offerings can help meet your business needs, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/services.

VMware Professional Services

VMware Education Services courses offer extensive hands‐on labs, case study examples, and course materials designed to be used as on‐the‐job reference tools. Courses are available onsite, in the classroom, and live online. For onsite pilot programs and implementation best practices, VMware Consulting Services provides offerings to help you assess, plan, build, and manage your virtual environment. To access information about education classes, certification programs, and consulting services, go to http://www.vmware.com/services.

Security Schemes

Basic Authentication basic

Endpoints

https://{nsxmanager}/api

URI Parameters

nsxmanager string required

This is the hostname or IP address of the NSX Manager

/1.0/appliance-management

Description

Working with Appliance Manager

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backup

Description

On-demand backup

post

Description

Backup NSX data on-demand

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backups

Description

Retrieve list of all backups available at configured backup location

get

Description

Retrieve list of all backups available at configured backup location

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Description

Appliance Manager backup settings

get

Description

Retrieve backup settings

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="backupRestoreSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ftpSettings">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="transferProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostNameIPAddress"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="backupDirectory"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="filenamePrefix"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passiveMode"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPRT"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPSV"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="backupFrequency">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="frequency"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dayOfWeek"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hourOfDay"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minuteOfHour"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeTables">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="excludeTable"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<backupRestoreSettings>
  <ftpSettings>
    <transferProtocol></transferProtocol>
    <hostNameIPAddress></hostNameIPAddress>
    <port></port>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <backupDirectory></backupDirectory>
    <filenamePrefix></filenamePrefix>
    <passiveMode></passiveMode>
    <useEPRT></useEPRT>
    <useEPSV></useEPSV>
  </ftpSettings>
  <backupFrequency>
    <frequency></frequency>
    <dayOfWeek></dayOfWeek>
    <hourOfDay></hourOfDay>
    <minuteOfHour></minuteOfHour>
  </backupFrequency>
  <excludeTables>
    <excludeTable></excludeTable>
  </excludeTables>
</backupRestoreSettings>

delete

Description

Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/restore

Description

Restore data from a backup file

post

Description

Restore data from a backup file

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

restoreFile string required

file name of restore file

/1.0/appliance-management/system/locale

Description

Configure locale

get

Description

Retrieve locale info

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Configure locale

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="locale">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="language"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="country"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<locale>
  <language></language>
  <country></country>
</locale>

/1.0/appliance-management/system/network/dns

Description

Configure DNS

put

Description

Configure DNS

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="dns">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv4Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv6Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainList"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<dns>
  <ipv4Address></ipv4Address>
  <ipv6Address></ipv6Address>
  <domainList></domainList>
</dns>

delete

Description

Delete DNS servers

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/syslogserver

Description

Working with syslog servers

get

Description

Retrieve syslog servers

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Configure syslog servers

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="syslogserver">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="syslogServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<syslogserver>
  <syslogServer></syslogServer>
  <port></port>
  <protocol></protocol>
</syslogserver>

delete

Description

Delete syslog servers

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings

Description

Working with time settings

get

Description

Retrieve time settings

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Configure time or specify the NTP server to use for time synchronization

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="timeSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ntpServer">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="string"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datetime"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timezone"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<timeSettings>
  <ntpServer>
    <string></string>
  </ntpServer>
  <datetime></datetime>
  <timezone></timezone>
</timeSettings>

/1.0/directory/directory/updateEventLogServer

Description

Create EventLog server

post

Description

Create EventLog server

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="EventlogServer">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<EventlogServer>
  <id></id>
  <domainId></domainId>
  <hostName></hostName>
  <enabled></enabled>
</EventlogServer>

/1.0/directory/directory/updateLdapServer

Description

Create LDAP server

post

Description

Create LDAP server

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="LDAPServer">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<LDAPServer>
  <domainId></domainId>
  <hostName></hostName>
  <enabled></enabled>
</LDAPServer>

/1.0/directory/updateDomain

Description

Working with domains

post

Description

Register or update a domain with NSX Manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="DirectoryDomain">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netbiosName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="username"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<DirectoryDomain>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <netbiosName></netbiosName>
  <username></username>
  <password></password>
</DirectoryDomain>

/1.0/eventcontrol

Description

eventControl Operations

/1.0/eventcontrol/config/vm/{vmID}

Description

Retrieve per vm configuration for data collection

URI Parameters

vmID string required

MOID of the guest vm

get

Description

Retrieve per vm configuration for data collection

Security

  • basic

/1.0/eventcontrol/eventcontrol-root/request

Description

Data collection kill switch on/off

post

Description

Turn on/off data collection at global level

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="request">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<request>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</request>

/1.0/eventcontrol/vm/{vmID}/request

Description

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

URI Parameters

vmID string required

MOID of the guest vm

post

Description

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="perVmConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<perVmConfig>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</perVmConfig>

/2.0/auditlog

Description

Get NSX Manager audit logs

get

Description

Get NSX Manager audit logs

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex string

optional; specify starting point for retrieving the logs

pageSize string

optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

Description

Configuring Data Security

Description

Classification values associated with regulations

get

Description

Security

  • basic

/2.0/dlp/completedscansummaries

Description

Retrieve start and end time, total number of vm's scanned, and total number of violations for the last five completed data security scans

get

Description

Retrieve scan summaries

Security

  • basic

/2.0/dlp/excludableareas

Description

Retrieve list of datacenters, clusters, and resource pools that are excludable from policy inspection

get

Description

Retrieve list of datacenters, clusters, and resource pools that are excludable from policy inspection

Security

  • basic

/2.0/dlp/policy/FileFilters

Description

Configure file filters for scanning

put

Description

Configure file filters for scanning

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="FileFilters">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scanAllFiles"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastModifiedAfter"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extensionsIncluded"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extensions"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<FileFilters>
  <scanAllFiles></scanAllFiles>
  <lastModifiedAfter></lastModifiedAfter>
  <extensionsIncluded></extensionsIncluded>
  <extensions></extensions>
</FileFilters>

/2.0/dlp/policy/classificationvalues

Description

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

put

Description

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="set">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ClassificationValue">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element name="classification">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="providerName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="customizable"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<set>
  <ClassificationValue>
    <id></id>
    <classification>
      <id></id>
      <name></name>
      <providerName></providerName>
      <description></description>
      <customizable></customizable>
    </classification>
    <value></value>
  </ClassificationValue>
</set>

/2.0/dlp/policy/excludedareas

Description

(DEPRECATED; use PUT /2.0/dlp/policy/excludedsecuritygroups instead) Exclude areas from policy inspection

put

Description

(DEPRECATED; use PUT /2.0/dlp/policy/excludedsecuritygroups instead) Exclude areas from policy inspection

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="set">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="string"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<set>
  <string></string>
</set>

/2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}

Description

Activate a registered vShield solution

URI Parameters

vendorID string required

VMware-assigned ID for the vendor

altitude string required

VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host

post

Description

Activate a solution that has been registered and located

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="moid"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

</ActivationInfo>

  • basic

/2.0/nwfabric/configure

Description

Network virtualization components

post

Description

You install the network infrastructure components in your virtual environment on a per‐cluster level for each vCenter server, which deploys the required software on all hosts in the cluster. This software is also referred to as an NSX vSwitch. When a new host is added to this cluster, the required software is automatically installed on the newly added host. After the network infrastructure is installed on a cluster, Logical Firewall is enabled on that cluster.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string

Resets communication between NSX Manager and a host or cluster. The resourceId is the ID of the cluster or host that is retrieved from the vCenter managed object browser. Set to "synchronize" to reset communication.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

put

Description

This API call can be used to upgrade network virtualization components. After NSX Manager is upgraded, previously prepared clusters must have the 6.x network virtualization components installed.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

delete

Description

Removes previously installed VIBs, tears down NSX manager to ESX messaging, and remove any other network fabric dependent features like logical wires etc. If a feature like logical wire is being used in your environment, this call fails.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId></featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

/2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Working with services on a scope

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

get

Description

List services that have been created on the scope

Security

  • basic

post

Description

Create a new service on the specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:byte" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName/>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol>mandatory</applicationProtocol>
    <value>mandatory</value>
  </element>
</application>

/2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Description

Working with a specified service

URI Parameters

applicationId string required

Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol></applicationProtocol>
    <value></value>
  </element>
</application>

delete

Description

Delete the specified service

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

/2.0/services/applicationgroup

Description

Operations on Application Groups

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Working with service groups

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

The scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

post

Description

Create a new service group on the specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<applicationGroup>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</applicationGroup>

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Description

Working with an individual service group

URI Parameters

applicationgroupId string required

Application group ID

get

Description

Retrieve details about a service group

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<applicationGroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
  </member>
</applicationGroup>

delete

Description

Delete a service group from a scope

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

Description

Add or delete service group members

URI Parameters

moref string required

Management object reference to the member

put

Description

Add a member to the service group

Security

  • basic

delete

Description

Delete a member from the service group

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Create a pool of IP addresses

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

get

Description

Read all IP Pools in a scope

Security

  • basic

post

Description

Create a pool of IP addresses

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipamAddressPool>
  <name></name>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Description

Working with a specified IP pool

URI Parameters

poolId string required

Specified IP pool

get

Description

Retrieve details about the IP pool

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify an IP pool

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipamAddressPool>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <id></id>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

delete

Description

Delete an IP pool

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Description

Work with IP's and their allocation status in IP Pools

get

Description

Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

Security

  • basic

post

Description

Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressRequest">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="allocationMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressRequest>
  <allocationMode></allocationMode>
  <ipAddress></ipAddress>
</ipAddressRequest>

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

Description

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

URI Parameters

ipAddress string required

The Id of the ip address to release, e.g. '192.168.10.10'

delete

Description

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipset

Description

Operations on IP Sets

/2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

URI Parameters

For scopeMoref use "globalroot-0" for non-universal IP sets and use "universalroot-0" for universal IP sets.

get

Description

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

URI Parameters

ipsetId string required

The IPset to be queried or changed

get

Description

Retrieve an individual IPset

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify an existing IPset

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</ipset>

delete

Description

delete an IPset

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Set to "true" when forcing the removal of an IP set.

/2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref}

URI Parameters

For scopeMoref use "globalroot-0" for non-universal IP sets and use "universalroot-0" for universal IP sets.

creates a new IPset

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</ipset>

/2.0/services/licensing/capacityusage

Description

The licensing capacity usage API command reports usage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

get

Description

Read capacity usage information on the useage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<featureCapacityUsageList>
  <featureCapacityUsageInfo>
    <capacityUsageInfo>
      <capacityType></capacityType>
      <usageCount></usageCount>
    </capacityUsageInfo>
    <feature></feature>
  </featureCapacityUsageInfo>
</featureCapacityUsageList>

/2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Working with MAC Sets.

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases. Universal MAC sets are read-only from secondary managers.

post

Description

Create a MACset on a specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>

get

  • basic

/2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Description

Operations on an individual MACset

URI Parameters

macsetId string required

Specified MACset ID (Can be retrieved by listing the MACset on a scope)

get

Description

Retrieve details about a MACset

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify an existing MACset

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>

delete

Description

Delete a MACset

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates forced or unforced delete. With forced delete, the object is deleted even if used in other places such as firewall rules, causing invalid referrals. For unforced delete, the object is deleted only if it is no used by other configurations; otherwise the delete fails

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy

Description

Working with security policies (Endpoint, firewall, network introspection services applied to security group)

post

Description

Create a security policy

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="precedence"/>
        <xs:element name="parent">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="securityGroupBinding">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="actionsByCategory">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="actionType"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActionEnforced"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActive"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isEnabled"/>
                    <xs:element name="secondarySecurityGroup">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="applications">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="application">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
                    <xs:element name="scope">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                  <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="class"/>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="direction"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="outsideSecondaryContainer"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicy>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <precedence></precedence>
  <parent>
    <objectId></objectId>
  </parent>
  <securityGroupBinding>
    <objectId></objectId>
  </securityGroupBinding>
  <actionsByCategory>
    <category></category>
    <action class="">
      <name></name>
      <description></description>
      <category></category>
      <actionType></actionType>
      <isActionEnforced></isActionEnforced>
      <isActive></isActive>
      <isEnabled></isEnabled>
      <secondarySecurityGroup>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </secondarySecurityGroup>
      <applications>
        <application>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </application>
        <applicationGroup>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </applicationGroup>
      </applications>
      <logged></logged>
      <scope>
        <id></id>
        <name></name>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      </scope>
    </action>
    <direction></direction>
    <outsideSecondaryContainer></outsideSecondaryContainer>
    </actionsByCategory>
</securityPolicy>

post

Import a security policy configuration

  • basic

Query Parameters

suffix string

(optional) Added after names

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicyHierarchy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="securityPolicy"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="securityGroup"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicyHierarchy>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <securityPolicy></securityPolicy>
  <securityGroup></securityGroup>
</securityPolicyHierarchy>

get

Description

Export a Service Composer configuration and save to your desktop for use as a backup

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

policyIds string

Comma separated security policy id's

prefix string

(optional) Some prefix to add before the names of the objects in the exported XML

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}

Description

Specific security policy

URI Parameters

ID string required

ID of desired security policy (or 'all' to include all security policies for the securityPolicyID read method)

get

  • basic

put

Description

Edit a security policy

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="precedence"/>
              <xs:element name="parent">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="securityGroupBinding">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="actionsByCategory">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                    <xs:element name="action">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="actionType"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActionEnforced"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActive"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isEnabled"/>
                          <xs:element name="secondarySecurityGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="applications">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element name="application">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
                          <xs:element name="scope">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                        <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="class"/>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="direction"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="outsideSecondaryContainer"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicy>
  <securityPolicy>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <precedence></precedence>
    <parent>
      <objectId></objectId>
    </parent>
    <securityGroupBinding>
      <objectId></objectId>
    </securityGroupBinding>
    <actionsByCategory>
      <category></category>
      <action class="">
        <name></name>
        <description></description>
        <category></category>
        <actionType></actionType>
        <isActionEnforced></isActionEnforced>
        <isActive></isActive>
        <isEnabled></isEnabled>
        <secondarySecurityGroup>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </secondarySecurityGroup>
        <applications>
          <application>
            <objectId></objectId>
          </application>
          <applicationGroup>
            <objectId></objectId>
          </applicationGroup>
        </applications>
        <logged></logged>
        <scope>
          <id></id>
          <name></name>
          <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        </scope>
      </action>
      <direction></direction>
      <outsideSecondaryContainer></outsideSecondaryContainer>
    </actionsByCategory>
  </securityPolicy>
</securityPolicy>

delete

Description

Delete a security policy

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

If set to true, security policy is deleted even if it is being used somewhere

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}/securityactions

Description

Security actions for a security policy

get

Description

Retrieve security actions for a security policy

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/virtualmachine/{ID}/securityactions

Description

Fetch the security actions applicable on a virtual machine

URI Parameters

ID string required

VM ID

get

Description

Fetch the security actions applicable on a virtual machine

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup

Description

Operations on securitygroups

/2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Description

Create a new security group on a global scope or universal scope. Use either "globalroot-0" or "universalroot-0". Universal security groups are read-only when querying a secondary NSX manager.

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

post

Description

Create a new security group on a global scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

put

Description

Update a specific security group

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

/2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Information on internal security groups

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Specified transport zone (scope)

get

Description

Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

Security

  • basic

URI Parameters

virtualMachineId string required

Specified virtual machine

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}

Description

Operations to list information about security groups on a given scope

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterID / portgroupID in upgrade use cases

get

Description

List all the security groups created on a specific scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isUniversal"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <isUniversal></isUniversal>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</securitygroup>

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityTag">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ssoConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoLookupServiceUrl"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUserpassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
  <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
  <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>

/2.0/services/taskservice/job

Description

Working with filtering criteria and paging information for jobs on the task framework

get

Description

Query job instances by criterion

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex integer

Start index (0 by default)

pageSize integer

Page size (10 by default)

sortBy string

Always sorted by "startTime"

sortOrderAscending boolean

Sort in ascending order of start time (true/false)

Certificates and certificate chains

post

Description

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="trustObject">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pemEncoding"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

</trustObject>

Certificate specified by ID

URI Parameters

certificateId string required

get

Description

Retrieve the certificate object specified by ID. If the ID specifies a chain, multiple certificate objects are retrieved.

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{scopeId}

Description

Working with vShield Edge self-signed certificates

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Scope ID

post

Description

Create a single certificate

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="trustObject">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pemEncoding"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="privateKey"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passphrase"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<trustObject>
  <pemEncoding></pemEncoding>
  <privateKey></privateKey>
  <passphrase></passphrase>
</trustObject>

/2.0/services/truststore/csr/scope/{scopeId}

Description

CSRs for specific scope

URI Parameters

Specified scope

get

Description

Query CSRs for specific scope

Security

  • basic

CSR ID

  • basic

Query Parameters

Description

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore/csr/{scopeId}

Description

Create Certificate Signing Requests (CSRs)

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Specified scope ID

post

Description

Create a CSR

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="csr">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="subject">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="attribute">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="algorithm"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="keySize"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<csr>
  <subject>
    <attribute>
      <key></key>
      <value></value>
    </attribute>
  </subject>
  <algorithm></algorithm>
  <keySize></keySize>
</csr>

/2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value}

URI Parameters

value integer required

value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable
