Description

Enable or disable a user account

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Description

Manage roles for users

URI Parameters

userId string required

user to retrieve role information from

get

Description

Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

Security

  • basic

post

Description

Add role and resources for a user

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isGroup boolean required

Set to "true" to apply to a group; set to "false" to apply to an individual user

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

put

Description

Change a user's role

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

delete

Description

Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/si/deploy

Description

Security fabric

post

Description

Deploy security fabric

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startTime string

Time to start deployment task. If not specified, deploy immediately

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>

put

Description

Upgrade service to recent version

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startTime string

optional; specify time to start upgrade

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceInstanceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <serviceInstanceId></serviceInstanceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerIp"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isPrimary"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

/2.0/vdn/config

Description

Configurations of Segment ID's and Multicast Ranges for logical switches

/2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

Description

Operations on multicast range Pools for logical switches. Specifying a multicast address range helps in spreading traffic across your network to avoid overloading a single multicast address.A virtualized network‐ready host is assigned an IP address from this range.

post

Description

Adds a multicast range for logical switches. The address range is inclusive – the beginning and ending addresses are included.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to "true" when creating a universal multicast range.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<multicastRange>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>

get

Description

List all configured VDN Multicast Pools. Universal pools will have the property isUniversal set tot true.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<multicastRanges>
  <multicastRange>
    <id></id>
    <name></name>
    <desc></desc>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
  </multicastRange>
</multicastRanges>

/2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Description

Operations in individual multicast range Pools for logical switches

URI Parameters

multicastAddresssRangeId string required

A valid multicast Pool range Id

get

Description

Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<multicastRange>
  <id></id>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>

put

Description

Update an individual multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<multicastRange>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <end></end>
</multicastRange>

delete

Description

Delete an individual Multicast range pool. If the multicast pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

Description

Query allocated resources

get

Description

Retrieve a list of resources allocated

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

type string

set to "segmentId" or "multicastAddress"

pagesize string

The pagesize parameter is an optional parameter that limits the maximum number of entries returned by the API. The default value for this parameter is 256 and the valid range is 1‐1024.

startindex string

The startindex parameter is an optional parameter which specifies the starting point for retrieving the resources. If this parameter is not specified, resources are retrieved from the beginning.

/2.0/vdn/config/segments

Description

You can specify one or more segment ID pools that is used to provide virtual network identifiers to logical switches which helps you isolate your network traffic.

post

Description

You can add a new segment ID range that provides virtual network identifiers to logical switches. More than one segment ID range is supported in the system. The segment range is inclusive – the beginning and ending IDs are included.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to "true" when creating a universal VNI pool.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<segmentRange>
  <name></name>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</segmentRange>

get

Description

Lists all Segment ID Pools.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Description

Operations on individual segment ID Pool

URI Parameters

segmentPoolId string required

A valid segment Pool Id

get

Description

Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<segmentRange>
  <id></id>
  <name></name>
  <desc></desc>
  <begin></begin>
  <end></end>
</segmentRange>

put

Description

Update an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<segmentRange>
  <end></end>
  <name></name>
</segmentRange>

delete

Description

Delete an individual segment ID Pool. If the segment pool is universal the API call must be made to the primary NSX manager.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

Description

Managing the logical switch UDP port.

get

Description

View configured UDP port for VXLAN.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<int>4789</int>

/2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

Description

You can view the UDP port for VXLAN

URI Parameters

portNumber string required

A valid UDP Port for VXLAN

put

Description

You can change the UDP port for the logical switch. If not set, the port defaults to port 8472.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/controller

Description

Working with NSX controllers - For the unicast or hybrid control plane mode, you must add an NSX controller to manage overlay transport and provide East-West routing. The controller optimizes virtual machine broadcast (ARP only) traffic, and the learning is stored on the host and the controller.

post

Description

Adds a new NSX controller on the specified given cluster. The hostId parameter is optional. The resourcePoolId can be either the clusterId or resourcePoolId. The IP address of the controller node will be allocated from the specified IP pool. deployType determines the controller node memory size and can be small, medium, or large. However, different controller deployment types are not currently supported because the OVF overrides it and different OVF types require changes in the manager build scripts. Despite not being supported, an arbitrary deployType size must still be specified or an error will be returned. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="controllerSpec">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="deployType"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="networkId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<controllerSpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <ipPoolId></ipPoolId>
  <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
  <hostId></hostId>
  <datastoreId></datastoreId>
  <deployType></deployType>
  <networkId></networkId>
  <password></password>
</controllerSpec>

get

Description

Retrieves details and runtime status for all controllers. Runtime status can be one of the following: Deploying ‐ controller is being deployed and the procedure has not completed yet. Removing ‐ controller is being removed and the procedure has not completed yet. Running ‐ controller has been deployed and can respond to API invocation. Unknown ‐ controller has been deployed but fails to respond to API invocation.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<controllers>
  <controller>
    <id></id>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    <status></status>
  </controller>
</controllers>

get

        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sslEnabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>

</controllerConfig>

/2.0/vdn/scopes

Description

A network scope is the networking infrastructure within provider virtual datacenters. Read all scopes (transport zones), or create a new scope (Transport Zone).

get

Description

Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes / Transport Zones

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<vdnScopes>
  <vdnScope>
    <objectId>vdnscope-1</objectId>
    <objectTypeName>VdnScope</objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
    <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
    <revision>0</revision>
    <type>
      <typeName>VdnScope</typeName>
    </type>
    <name>tz-1</name>
    <description></description>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    <id>vdnscope-1</id>
    <clusters>
      <cluster>
        <cluster>
          <objectId>domain-c21</objectId>
          <objectTypeName>ClusterComputeResource</objectTypeName>
          <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
          <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
          <revision>10</revision>
          <type>
            <typeName>ClusterComputeResource</typeName>
          </type>
          <name>Cluster-1</name>
          <scope>
            <id>datacenter-2</id>
            <objectTypeName>Datacenter</objectTypeName>
            <name>Datacenter-1</name>
          </scope>
          <clientHandle></clientHandle>
          <extendedAttributes/>
          <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
          <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
        </cluster>
      </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <virtualWireCount>2</virtualWireCount>
    <controlPlaneMode>UNICAST_MODE</controlPlaneMode>
  </vdnScope>
</vdnScopes>

post

Description

Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ. You must specify the clusters that are to be part of the network scope. You must have the VLAN ID, UUID of the vCenter Server, and vDS ID.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to "true" when creating a universal transport zone.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdnScope">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="clusters">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="cluster">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="cluster">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<vdnScope>
  <name></name>
  <clusters>
    <cluster>
      <cluster>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </cluster>
    </cluster>
  </clusters>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
  <description></description>
</vdnScope>

/2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

Description

Read, update and delete an existing scope (transport Zone)

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

A valid scope Id

get

Description

Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

Security

  • basic

post

Description

Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string required

Mandatory queryParameter, use 'expand' to add a cluster, or 'shrink' to remove a cluster from the TZ

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdnScope">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="clusters">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="cluster">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="cluster">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<vdnScope>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <clusters>
    <cluster>
      <cluster>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </cluster>
    </cluster>
  </clusters>
</vdnScope>

/2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

A valid scope Id

get

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex string

An optional paramater that sets the starting point for listing logical switches

pageSize string

An optional paramater that sets the number of entries returned. Range is 1-1024.

post

Description

Creates a logicalSwitch. To create a universal logical switch use the appropriate universal scope as the scopeId and use the primary NSX manager.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="virtualWireCreateSpec">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="tenantId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="controlPlaneMode"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <tenantId></tenantId>
  <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</virtualWireCreateSpec>

/2.0/vdn/switches

Description

This collection of methods are used to configure and prepare the VDS's for the use with NSX. Before creating a logical switch, ensure that you have installed the network virtualization components on the appropriate clusters and that you have configured VXLAN on the appropriate clusters.

post

Description

The MTU is the maximum amount of data that can be transmitted in one packet before it is divided into smaller packets. The frames are slightly larger in size because of the traffic encapsulation, so the MTU required is higher than the standard MTU. You must set the MTU for each switch to 1600 or higher.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vdsContext">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="switch">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="teaming"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<vdsContext>
  <switch>
    <objectId></objectId>
      <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
      </type>
      <name></name>
      <revision></revision>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  </switch>
  <teaming></teaming>
  <mtu></mtu>
</vdsContext>

get

Description

You can retrieve all configured switches.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<vdsContexts>
  <vdsContext>
    <switch>
      <objectId></objectId>
      <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
      </type>
      <name></name>
      <revision></revision>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    </switch>
    <teaming></teaming>
    <mtu></mtu>
  </vdsContext>
</vdsContexts>

  • basic

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>

          <xs:complexType>

              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>

          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>

          <xs:complexType>

              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="switchId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vlanId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  </sourceHost>

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ipDiscoveryConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>

          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

    <enabled></enabled>
  </ipDiscoveryConfig>

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="FlowConfiguration">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="collectFlows"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ignoreBlockedFlows"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ignoreLayer2Flows"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sourceIPs"/>
        <xs:element name="sourceContainer">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="destinationIPs"/>
        <xs:element name="destinationContainer">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="destinationPorts"/>
        <xs:element name="service">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<FlowConfiguration>
  <collectFlows></collectFlows>
  <ignoreBlockedFlows></ignoreBlockedFlows>
  <ignoreLayer2Flows></ignoreLayer2Flows>
  <sourceIPs></sourceIPs>
  <sourceContainer>
    <name></name>
    <id></id>
    <type></type>
  </sourceContainer>
  <destinationIPs></destinationIPs>
  <destinationContainer>
    <name></name>
    <id></id>
    <type></type>
  </destinationContainer>
  <destinationPorts></destinationPorts>
  <service>
    <name></name>
    <id></id>
  </service>
</FlowConfiguration>

/2.1/app/flow/flowstats

Description

Retrieve flow statistics for a datacenter, port group, VM, or vNIC

get

Description

Retrieve flow statistics for a datacenter, port group, VM, or vNIC

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

contextId string

vc-moref-id of the datacenter, portgroup, vm, or UUID of the vNIC for which traffic flow is to be retrieved

flowType string

Type of flow to be retrieved (TCP_UDP|LAYER2|LAYER3)

startTime string

Flows with start time greater than specified time are retrieved

endTime string

Flows with start time lower than specified time are retrieved

startIndex integer

(optional) Specifies starting point for retrieval. If not specified, start from the beginning by default

pageSize integer

(optional) Limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

/2.1/app/flow/flowstats/info

Description

Flow statistics info

get

Description

Retrieve flow statistics info

Security

  • basic

  • basic

/3.0/ai/records

Description

Get aggregated user activity (action records) using parameters. Requires vShield Endpoint and NSX Endpoint configured, and Data collection enabled on 1+ vm's

get

Description

Get aggregated user activity

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

query string required

Name of report (resource,adg,containers,sam,vma)

interval string required

Relative time to current time (number followed by either m,h,d,s)

Example: 60m
stime string

Start time for query

etime string

End time for query

param string

Parameter to be applied to query (:: :operator)

pagesize string

Number of records to retrieve (recommended between 100-2000)

startindex string

Start record number for pagination

/3.0/directory/updateDomain

Description

Working with domains

post

Description

Register or update a domain with NSX Manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="DirectoryDomain">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netbiosName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="username"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<DirectoryDomain>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <netbiosName></netbiosName>
  <username></username>
  <password></password>
</DirectoryDomain>

Set this to 'upgrade'

/4.0/edges

Description

Installed NSX Edges in your inventory

post

Description

Install NSX Edge services gateway or logical router, depending on request body

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to "true" when creating a universal logical router. Note the

in the request body must be "DISTRIBUTED_ROUTER"

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="edge">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datacenterMoid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="tenant"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="fqdn"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vseLogLevel"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableAesni"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableFips"/>
        <xs:element name="appliances">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applianceSize"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableCoreDump"/>
              <xs:element name="appliance">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vmFolderId"/>
                    <xs:element name="customField">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="cpuReservation">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="limit"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="reservation"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="shares"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="memoryReservation">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="limit"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="reservation"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="shares"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="vnics">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="vnic">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="index"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="portgroupId"/>
                    <xs:element name="addressGroups">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="addressGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryAddress"/>
                                <xs:element name="secondaryAddresses">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="subnetMask"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="macAddress">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="edgeVmHaIndex"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="fenceParameter">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableProxyArp"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSendRedirects"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isConnected"/>
                    <xs:element name="inShapingPolicy">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="averageBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="peakBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="burstSize"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inherited"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="outShapingPolicy">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="averageBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="peakBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="burstSize"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inherited"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="cliSettings">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="remoteAccess"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="autoConfiguration">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rulePriority"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dnsClient">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryDns"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secondaryDns"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="queryDaemon">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<edge>
  <datacenterMoid></datacenterMoid>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <description></description>
  <tenant></tenant>
  <fqdn></fqdn>
  <vseLogLevel></vseLogLevel>
  <enableAesni></enableAesni>
  <enableFips></enableFips>
  <appliances>
    <applianceSize></applianceSize>
    <enableCoreDump></enableCoreDump>
    <appliance>
      <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
      <datastoreId></datastoreId>
      <hostId></hostId>
      <vmFolderId></vmFolderId>
      <customField>
        <key></key>
        <value></value>
      </customField>
      <cpuReservation>
        <limit></limit>
        <reservation></reservation>
        <shares></shares>
      </cpuReservation>
      <memoryReservation>
        <limit></limit>
        <reservation></reservation>
        <shares></shares>
      </memoryReservation>
    </appliance>
  </appliances>
  <vnics>
    <vnic>
      <index></index>
      <name></name>
      <type></type>
      <portgroupId></portgroupId>
      <addressGroups>
        <addressGroup>
          <primaryAddress></primaryAddress>
          <secondaryAddresses>
            <ipAddress></ipAddress>
          </secondaryAddresses>
          <subnetMask></subnetMask>
        </addressGroup>
      </addressGroups>
      <macAddress>
        <edgeVmHaIndex></edgeVmHaIndex>
        <value></value>
      </macAddress>
      <fenceParameter>
        <key></key>
        <value></value>
      </fenceParameter>
      <mtu></mtu>
      <enableProxyArp></enableProxyArp>
      <enableSendRedirects></enableSendRedirects>
      <isConnected></isConnected>
      <inShapingPolicy>
        <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
        <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
        <burstSize></burstSize>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <inherited></inherited>
      </inShapingPolicy>
      <outShapingPolicy>
        <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
        <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
        <burstSize></burstSize>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <inherited></inherited>
      </outShapingPolicy>
    </vnic>
  </vnics>
  <cliSettings>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <remoteAccess></remoteAccess>
  </cliSettings>
  <autoConfiguration>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <rulePriority></rulePriority>
  </autoConfiguration>
  <dnsClient>
    <primaryDns></primaryDns>
    <secondaryDns></secondaryDns>
    <domainName></domainName>
  </dnsClient>
  <queryDaemon>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <port></port>
  </queryDaemon>
</edge>

get

Description

Retrieve a list of NSX Edges in your inventory or use the query parameters to filter results by datacenter or port group

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

datacenter string

Retrieve Edges by datacenter MoId

tenant string

Retrieve Edges on specified tenant (by tenant ID)

pg string

Retrieve Edges with one interface on specified port group (by port group MoId)

/4.0/edges/jobs

Description

NSX Edge async jobs

get

Description

Query jobs. Assumes Edge is configured in async mode, where ?async=true is used at the end of any 4.0 service configuration URI for POST, PUT, and DELETE calls.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

status string

status set to "all" or "active"

/4.0/edges/jobs/{jobId}

Description

Status of Edge async jobs. Assumes Edge is configured in async mode, where ?async=true is used at the end of any 4.0 service configuration URI for POST, PUT, and DELETE calls.

URI Parameters

jobId string required

Job ID

get

Description

Retrieve job status (SUCCESS/FAILED/QUEUED/RUNNING/ROLLBACK), URI of the resource, and ID of the resource as shown in response body

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}

Description

NSX Edge operations

URI Parameters

edgeId string required

Specified Edge ID

post

Description

Manage NSX Edge

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string required

Options include "forcesync" (resync Edge vm's), "redeploy" ()

get

Description

Retrieve Edge details

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Filter read of Edges to display only universal logical routers

put

Description

Update the NSX Edge configuration

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="edge">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datacenterMoid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="fqdn"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableAesni"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableFips"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vseLogLevel"/>
        <xs:element name="vnics">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="vnic">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="index"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="portgroupId"/>
                    <xs:element name="addressGroups">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="addressGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryAddress"/>
                                <xs:element name="secondaryAddresses">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="subnetMask"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableProxyArp"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSendRedirects"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isConnected"/>
                    <xs:element name="inShapingPolicy">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="averageBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="peakBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="burstSize"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inherited"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="outShapingPolicy">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="averageBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="peakBandwidth"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="burstSize"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inherited"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="appliances">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applianceSize"/>
              <xs:element name="appliance">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vmFolderId"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="cliSettings">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="remoteAccess"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="features">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="firewall">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="defaultPolicy">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loggingEnabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="rules">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="rule">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ruleTag"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ruleType"/>
                                <xs:element name="source">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="exclude"/>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="groupingObjectId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="destination"/>
                                <xs:element name="application">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loggingEnabled"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="matchTranslated"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="routing">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="staticRouting">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="defaultRoute">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gatewayAddress"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="staticRoutes">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element name="route">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nextHop"/>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="ospf">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="highAvailability">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="declareDeadTime"/>
                    <xs:element name="logging">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enable"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logLevel"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="syslog">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
                    <xs:element name="serverAddresses">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="ipsec">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                    <xs:element name="logging">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enable"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logLevel"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="sites">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="site">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="localId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="localIp"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="peerId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="encryptionAlgorithm"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enablePfs"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dhGroup"/>
                                <xs:element name="localSubnets">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="subnet"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element name="peerSubnets">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="subnet"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="psk"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="authenticationMode"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="global">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="caCertificates"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="crlCertificates"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="dhcp">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                    <xs:element name="staticBindings">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="staticBinding">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="autoConfigureDNS"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindingId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vmId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnicId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostname"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="defaultGateway"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="leaseTime"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="ipPools">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="ipPool">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="autoConfigureDNS"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="poolId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipRange"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="defaultGateway"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="leaseTime"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="logging">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enable"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logLevel"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="nat">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="natRules">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="natRule">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ruleId"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ruleTag"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ruleType"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="originalAddress"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="translatedAddress"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loggingEnabled"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="originalPort"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="translatedPort"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="autoConfiguration">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rulePriority"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<edge>
  <id></id>
  <description></description>
  <datacenterMoid></datacenterMoid>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <fqdn></fqdn>
  <enableAesni></enableAesni>
  <enableFips></enableFips>
  <vseLogLevel></vseLogLevel>
  <vnics>
    <vnic>
      <index></index>
      <name></name>
      <type></type>
      <portgroupId></portgroupId>
      <addressGroups>
        <addressGroup>
          <primaryAddress></primaryAddress>
          <secondaryAddresses>
            <ipAddress></ipAddress>
          </secondaryAddresses>
          <subnetMask></subnetMask>
        </addressGroup>
      </addressGroups>
      <mtu></mtu>
      <enableProxyArp></enableProxyArp>
      <enableSendRedirects></enableSendRedirects>
      <isConnected></isConnected>
      <inShapingPolicy>
        <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
        <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
        <burstSize></burstSize>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <inherited></inherited>
      </inShapingPolicy>
      <outShapingPolicy>
        <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
        <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
        <burstSize></burstSize>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <inherited></inherited>
      </outShapingPolicy>
    </vnic>
  </vnics>
  <appliances>
    <applianceSize></applianceSize>
    <appliance>
      <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
      <datastoreId></datastoreId>
      <vmFolderId></vmFolderId>
    </appliance>
  </appliances>
  <cliSettings>
    <remoteAccess></remoteAccess>
    <userName></userName>
  </cliSettings>
  <features>
    <firewall>
      <defaultPolicy>
        <action></action>
        <loggingEnabled></loggingEnabled>
      </defaultPolicy>
      <rules>
        <rule>
          <id></id>
          <ruleTag></ruleTag>
          <name></name>
          <ruleType></ruleType>
          <source>
            <exclude></exclude>
            <groupingObjectId></groupingObjectId>
          </source>
          <destination></destination>
          <application>
            <applicationId></applicationId>
          </application>
          <action></action>
          <enabled></enabled>
          <loggingEnabled></loggingEnabled>
          <matchTranslated></matchTranslated>
        </rule>
      </rules>
    </firewall>
    <routing>
      <staticRouting>
        <defaultRoute>
          <vnic></vnic>
          <gatewayAddress></gatewayAddress>
          <description></description>
        </defaultRoute>
        <staticRoutes>
          <route>
            <vnic></vnic>
            <network></network>
            <nextHop></nextHop>
            <type></type>
          </route>
        </staticRoutes>
      </staticRouting>
      <ospf>
        <enabled></enabled>
      </ospf>
    </routing>
    <highAvailability>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <declareDeadTime></declareDeadTime>
      <logging>
        <enable></enable>
        <logLevel></logLevel>
      </logging>
    </highAvailability>
    <syslog>
      <protocol></protocol>
      <serverAddresses>
        <ipAddress></ipAddress>
      </serverAddresses>
    </syslog>
    <ipsec>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <logging>
        <enable></enable>
        <logLevel></logLevel>
      </logging>
      <sites>
        <site>
          <enabled></enabled>
          <name></name>
          <localId></localId>
          <localIp></localIp>
          <peerId></peerId>
          <encryptionAlgorithm></encryptionAlgorithm>
          <mtu></mtu>
          <enablePfs></enablePfs>
          <dhGroup></dhGroup>
          <localSubnets>
            <subnet></subnet>
          </localSubnets>
          <peerSubnets>
            <subnet></subnet>
          </peerSubnets>
          <psk></psk>
          <authenticationMode></authenticationMode>
        </site>
      </sites>
      <global>
        <caCertificates/>
        <crlCertificates/>
      </global>
    </ipsec>
    <dhcp>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <staticBindings>
        <staticBinding>
          <autoConfigureDNS></autoConfigureDNS>
          <bindingId></bindingId>
          <vmId></vmId>
          <vnicId></vnicId>
          <hostname></hostname>
          <ipAddress></ipAddress>
          <defaultGateway></defaultGateway>
          <leaseTime></leaseTime>
        </staticBinding>
      </staticBindings>
      <ipPools>
        <ipPool>
          <autoConfigureDNS></autoConfigureDNS>
          <poolId></poolId>
          <ipRange></ipRange>
          <defaultGateway></defaultGateway>
          <leaseTime></leaseTime>
        </ipPool>
      </ipPools>
      <logging>
        <enable></enable>
        <logLevel></logLevel>
      </logging>
    </dhcp>
    <nat>
      <natRules>
        <natRule>
          <ruleId></ruleId>
          <ruleTag></ruleTag>
          <ruleType></ruleType>
          <action></action>
          <vnic></vnic>
          <originalAddress></originalAddress>
          <translatedAddress></translatedAddress>
          <loggingEnabled></loggingEnabled>
          <enabled></enabled>
          <protocol></protocol>
          <originalPort></originalPort>
          <translatedPort></translatedPort>
        </natRule>
      </natRules>
    </nat>
  </features>
  <autoConfiguration>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <rulePriority></rulePriority>
  </autoConfiguration>
</edge>

delete

Description

Delete specified Edge from database. Associated appliances are also deleted

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/aesni

Description

AESNI Setting

post

Description

Modify AESNI setting

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

enable boolean required

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/appliances

Description

Working with Edge appliances

post

Description

Change the size of both appliances

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

size string required

set to compact|large|xlarge

get

Description

Retrieve appliance configuration

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify appliance configuration (tip -- retrieve the config using GET call, then modify the parameters and send as body)

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/appliances/{haIndex}

Description

Manage a specified appliance using its HA index

URI Parameters

haIndex string required

Specified appliance HA index

get

Description

Get configuration of specified appliance

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Modify the configuration of the specified appliance

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="appliance">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vmFolderId"/>
        <xs:element name="customField">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="cpuReservation">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="limit"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="reservation"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="shares"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="memoryReservation">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="limit"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="reservation"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="shares"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<appliance>
  <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
  <datastoreId></datastoreId>
  <hostId></hostId>
  <vmFolderId></vmFolderId>
  <customField>
    <key></key>
    <value></value>
  </customField>
  <cpuReservation>
    <limit></limit>
    <reservation></reservation>
    <shares></shares>
  </cpuReservation>
  <memoryReservation>
    <limit></limit>
    <reservation></reservation>
    <shares></shares>
  </memoryReservation>
</appliance>

delete

Description

Delete the appliance

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/autoconfiguration

Description

Auto config is enabled by default. If you disable, you must add required NAT, firewall, routing rules

get

Description

Retrieve auto config settings for the Edge

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Change the auto configuration settings for the NSX Edge

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="autoConfiguration">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rulePriority"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<autoConfiguration>
  <enabled></enabled>
  <rulePriority></rulePriority>
</autoConfiguration>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/bridging/config

Description

Working with L2 bridging

get

Description

Retrieve bridge configuration

Security

  • basic

put

Description

Configure a bridge

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="bridges">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="version"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
        <xs:element name="bridge">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="virtualWire"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvportGroup"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<bridges>
  <version></version>
  <enabled></enabled>
  <bridge>
    <name></name>
    <virtualWire></virtualWire>
    <dvportGroup></dvportGroup>
  </bridge>
</bridges>
